â€œThis disarmingly self-satirizing entertainment gets more laughs than you might imagine out of a shaky premise; it manages to be genuinely touching and it rarely oversells itself. On Broadway these days, that amounts to a trifecta...Nobody is rewriting the history of musical theatre in 'The Prom,' but this is the kind of fast, funny, contemporary show that every season needs...Wickedly knowing while simultaneously wearing its heart on its sleeve."
